website_summaries.verdict: With a fair price, decent performance, and dead-simple setup, the SMC SMCWGBR14-N Barricade N router is about as well-rounded a Draft N router as you'll find. It also boasts impressive range and a smart design. We strongly recommend it for general home use.
pros: intuitive Web interface makes setup and maintenance a snap
while not exactly lifetime, the warranty is generous
cons: USB port is on the front, no support for 5.0Ghz frequency

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal for $16
customer_reviews.text: Since all the reviews are old, I decided to post my review. For $16 you really can't beat this if you're trying to save a few bucks. No problems setting it up, works as good as anything else I've tried. Bought mainly for the N wireless to improve streaming on my local network. There is a firmware update out there but unless you have issues, I advise you to pass on it. Not of big fan of flashing devices unless there are issues.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Antennas are NOT replaceable!
customer_reviews.text: This router provided only a marginal improvement over the Netgear router it replaced. I actually had to call customer service for help with configuration. The gentleman in India had to call his supervisor for help. Hint: DISABLE WI-FI by selecting the "Advanced" tab. Then select "Wi-Fi Protected Setup" and uncheck "Enable." Once configured, I discovered that the antennas don't screw in, and thus are not replaceable. I just assumed, based on their appearance, that they did. I pulled on one and removed it partially, and wires came along, but once replaced, no harm was done. I'm somewhat disappointed, and feel I should have spent more money on another more powerful router, or one which had replaceable antennas for more range.
customer_reviews.author: Alpaca Picnic

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This router works. My Dell Windows XP, HP Windows 7, iPhone 3, iPhone 4, Wii, Canon MX870 printer connect via wifi to it fine. My ISP is Timewarner and delivers 10MB high speed. However, if I streaming video from two PCs, the network becomes unusable (e.g. one Netflix, one Youtube). After using the router for a few days, the network becomes slow and then stops working. I have to reboot it. Note, this might be caused by Timewarner cable -- this may not be caused by this router). Occationally, there are conflicting IP addresses (it is configured to support DHCP so I don't understand why it allocates duplicate IP addresses in the first place).
customer_reviews.author: R. Zou

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless router with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical in setting up a wireless network at home because of all the nightmare stories I'd heard about the various products out there. But after reading the great reviews on this router I decided to take a chance. I did have some trouble getting it set up inititally, but they have a fairly easy online configuration utility on their web site, and with help from an excellent customer service, it was up and running pretty quickly. I've been using it primarily for Netflix movie downloads through my Sony Blu-ray player and have had reliable and very fast throughput for several weeks now with only a couple of drop-outs, which were quickly resolved. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Interested in wired gigabit speeds? Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically to use as a wired router/switch, as I read the wireless is subpar. Can confirm, wired speeds are also notably bad, at least out of the box. My current TP link gets 700mbps down and 800mbps up. I just switched it out with the SMC and would get usually around 30-50mbps, peaking sometimes around 100. I poked around the basic/advanced settings all I could to boost speeds but nothing seemed to help. Am returning and paying a bit more for a dedicated netgear gigabit switch.
customer_reviews.author: Brant McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for about a month now, and haven't had a single problem. Before purchasing I read a few reviews concerning problems with set-up. I initially had some challenges connecting, but realized I was making it harder than it needed to be, (regarding using a WEP key). Once I realized this was unnecessary for my application it connected right away, and has not had a problem yet. I also love that I can wirelessly connect to my printer now, great feature!! I can print from my laptop anywhere in the house, very cool. Excelent range too, all over the house, outside too.
customer_reviews.author: Marlisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Stable & fast.
customer_reviews.text: My last N-router was not terribly stable. Speed was unpredictable (even when plugged in directly with ethernet cable). The SMC has been awesome by comparison. I've had it running for months & haven't had to reset it and the wireless connections to 2 other PC's in the house stay up without issues as well. I'll definitely buy SMC again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: took some work to get it to operate correctly
customer_reviews.text: This unit took a lot to get it to work correctly. I went through all the set up directions and could not get it to work at all or it was sporadic. It would keep cutting out and I would have to reset it. After spending a few days changing settings, I managed to get it to work. I never had any more issues after that. It does have a nice feature where you can save the settings to your hard drive and reinstall them if you have to reboot the unit. The unit has worked flawlessly since I got the settings to work.
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 360 Live, Ipod Touch, LAN Comments
customer_reviews.text: This works great! My Xbox 360 slim connects instantantly using the wireless N, the NAN is "open" using this router right out of the box, My Ipod Touch connects without difficulty, my computer system works without problems, the wireless has great range, my Call of Duty 2 doesn't lag using the wireless N. Lifetime factory warranty, No worries with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I first purchased the new Linksys N Router... which - if you are planning on sharing a printer - is TERRIBLE. After hours of worthless tech support to properly configure the router, only to discover incredibly limited capabilities I returned the product and purchased the SMC. The SMC Barricade is a DREAM...configuration is simple! I'm running both ethernet and USB printers off of it, and it works seamlessly. ...and is incredibly fast! Thank you SMC!!
customer_reviews.author: SAZ

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding router and support
customer_reviews.text: It's always amazing to me when something works the way it's supposed to! Unlike other routers I've tried set up was a breeze. Speed at first was slow but a call to tech support (who was unbelievably patient with stupid me) had me update the firmware and after a reboot I'm getting the same speed as I get when my satellite modem in wired in directly.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Pekar

customer_reviews.title: Solved the problem
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in and it worked. Totally compatable with the old one that has been working for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terrance Nordmann

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Everything I hoped for. This router is a huge improvement over the last two Belkins. I've had it a couple of months and no problems so far. It's speedy, reliable, and well made. If it lasts, then it is a fantastic deal.
customer_reviews.author: Independent Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Finally a wifi router that works
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I finally dont have to deal with 'Linksys issues' anymore. Bought this router a month ago, it does what it supposed to do. Quite a rarity among other products. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: George Nevis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this router over others because we read that it was more reliable over longer distances. It works fine, we have a single story 3300 sq ft home. The router is in my office in the middle of the house. We get a strong single at both ends of the house. Setup was fine, had it working within an hour, we have 3 laptops running XP. 4 stars instead of 5 for features because it would have been nicer if it were dual band.
customer_reviews.author: cflutist

customer_reviews.title: 24 limit
customer_reviews.text: The router worked fine and very easy to set up. (Just turn on). I bought the router for a friend who wanted to block all wireless internet access and just allow one web site through. It did this very easy but only for 24 clients and I needed more. Don't know why the limit.
customer_reviews.author: S. Noggle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this router for a month with no problems with setup/use. The warranty is great. I had used a SMC non-wireless router in the past and never had a problem and had good support when I had a question.
customer_reviews.author: fish and dog man

customer_reviews.title: Wireless goes down occasionally (needs full reboot)
customer_reviews.text: We find that the wireless component of this router is somewhat unstable. It needs to be rebooted occasionally to get wireless working again. We installed the most current firmware so we are left with no options. Since we need this in our office, we had to go back to an older Cisco router since it is 100% reliable. I would not recommend this router for anyone that needs near 100% uptime.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rosario

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because of how inexpensive it is, but I'm using it in the back yard and it just works. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, compact, very easy set up, great functionality/tools, and good range. Unfortunately this router just has not been reliable. It started with frequent resets to recover dropped print server functionality and now it's dropping wireless connections and broadcast. Reset fixes it quick, but this went from monthly, to weekly, to now a daily activity. Didn't last 12 months. Time for a new router....
customer_reviews.author: Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this router. Actually I had to buy it 2x since the first one dropped connectivity every hour. Well the 2nd is doing the same. On top of it when I called support they informed me that they no longer support this product and I would have to call another company Mon-Fri. I guess my only option is to take a day off from work or return this one too.
customer_reviews.author: IT

customer_reviews.title: Good only for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for 2 years. Since last 3 months, I'm having problems. Everyday couple of times it will stop working, both wired and wireless connections. Turning the power off and on, just to this router, resolves the problem. I have the latest firm wire. SMC website shows this product in EOL.
customer_reviews.author: El Faro

customer_reviews.title: Great at first....
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat disappointed in this router. The first year it was working great with rock solid signal connection, but then the built in switch stopped working and now serves only as a WIFI router. It never fails to expect every major purchase you make goes haywire the day after the warranty expires... The rock sold connection has gone as well and it has to be reset periodically....If it had not failed this would be a solid 5-star product. Too bad...
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Peter Konig

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Have had the SMC router a short while, but it is doing a good job getting decent signals out to my remote office. No complaints. Now have had it 4 years and it still gets the signal out over a wide area. Tech Service was very helpful in working out a glitch involving HughesNet compatibility (turned out to be HughesNet's problem). I will buy again if ever need to....
customer_reviews.author: Honest Charley

customer_reviews.title: SMC SMCWGBR14-N Barricade N ProMax Draft 11n Wireless Gigabit Broadband Router
customer_reviews.text: Great router so far. I have been using for 2 or 3 months and haven't had any issues. Has all the standard features and wireless is working great. My routers burn out every couple of years normally. Hoping this will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: reliable and easy to use. good wifi and good distance easy to program. very light can place any where signal is strong
customer_reviews.author: Donavon Simonette

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 24 hours. Then ran into catastrophic failures. Refused to assign IP addresses, refused to maintain connections... turned into a nightmare trying to keep a basic connection open, running the system naked with all options off, even. Ended up boxing it up and returning it within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Julia and Erik

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Perfect Home Wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I am IT so I know routers - I have used several D-link and still have two at home and am just fedup with them. This SMC is just awesome, the spot where the D-links give me variable 60%-40% strength and keep disconnecting, this router gives me at least 80% signal strength. The 3 built-in antenna's help. The software is full of features and easy to setup. Perfect buy - I have heard SMC customer service is great too. The D-link customer service is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: F. Yamin

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISSAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: ARRIVED DEFECTIVE. HAD TO JUMP THROUGH HOOPS OF FIRE TO GET A REFUND. FINALLY TURNED IT OVER TO THE CREDIT CARD COMPANY TO HANDLE. WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: ValueRays

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an ageing D-Link with this. It is faster and more stable. No drop outs!
customer_reviews.author: W. Blauvelt

product_meta.title: SMC SMCWGBR14-N Barricade N ProMax Draft 11n Wireless Gigabit Broadband Router
product_meta.description:
The Barricade N ProMax Draft 11n Gigabit Broadband Router (SMCWGBR14-N) is the perfect all-in-one networking solution for connecting and sharing your high speed cable/xDSL internet connection. Designed for the home and office, this platform independent multi-functional router combines a 4-port 10/100/1000Mbps LAN switch, high speed Wireless-N (draft 802.11n) access point, NAT firewall with Stateful Packet Inspection (SPI), Intelligent stream handling technology, a Multi-function print server and a User friendly web-based management interface in one convenient device. The built-in wireless access point is 802.11n draft v2.0 certified while maintaining full backwards compatibility with the Wireless-G (802.11g) and Wireless-B (802.11b) standards. This next generation wireless networking standard utilizes advanced MIMO (Multiple-In, Multiple-Out) technology to deliver incredible speed and range. With wireless speeds up to 300Mbps and up to 11x the coverage, there is enough bandwidth to simultaneously stream video and audio, play online games, transfer large files, make VoIP calls and surf the Internet. Limited Life Time Warranty. 24/7 Technical Support 1-800-SMC-4YOU.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: NAT / SPI / DoS / MAC filter / VPN pass-through / DMZ / WEP / WPA / DHCP server support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars86 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
